snippet.textDisplay:
lol although I agree that people should not panic. I think its fair for people who are at a higher risk (ie. taxi drivers/hotel staff/medical professionals/airport staff/frequent flyers) to have masks on at these hotspots like hospitals and airports regardless of whether they are sick. I work as a management consultant, and fly weekly for work, masks are SOLD OUT in Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Bali, Batam, Manila. If your normal routine is not at risk of infection, please dont buyout all the masks.

What Mike said was right, the mask prevent people from spreading viruses and does not grant you immunity (ie. surgical masks). N95 masks and respirators provides a better seal in terms of keeping unwanted stuff out - that is true too. BUT, most people still get sick even after wearing masks because of INAPPROPRIATE USE OF MASKS and POOR HYGIENE.

snippet.textDisplay:
Again, from, grew up and still live in China. I truly feel we’re being punished for reacting quickly and strongly. Not quick enough, I’ll have to admit, certain scientists withheld information to have their thesis published first, the local government didn’t determine and release quick enough. But as soon as Dr. Zhong went there in person, announced that this disease can be transmitted from person to person which was right before the Chinese New Year, the government responded straight away at the the cost of huge economy loss. Locking down cities, cover all types of media and press with how to stay safe, why its highly encouraged to stay home and all kinds of essential information, and many nearby villages and towns are also in lock down or curfews. We didn’t have to do this. We could’ve done what the US did back in 2009, recover while losing. But we did the right thing before anybody looked our way, even the WHO only looked I’m our way AFTER we announced all the measures were taking. But now our people are suffering for it because of politics essentially.
It is very sad that we have to feel like maybe we didn’t have to do this, even though we all know by our heart that this is the right thing to do.
Please follow reliable and neutral sources like the WHO. Because let’s put the global economy aside, because I can say damaging China further eventually brings down the global economy all together, but some may not believe me, and some will say that China will be the one to lose the lost and that’s enough for them. So let’s put that aside. Let’s look at what kind of message is this delivering to the latest of the world?
With how the world works right now, an epidemic like this may easily happen again. If this is how China is being treated, do we think that specific nation will still choose to do the right thing? Do we WANT them to do the right thing? If it was your country right now, and you see how the world responds to honesty and responsible actions, will you choose to do the same thing still?
Please do think about what kind of a world we want to live in? Or at least feel safer to live in. That’s all I’ve got to say.
snippet.textOriginal:
Again, from, grew up and still live in China. I truly feel we’re being punished for reacting quickly and strongly. Not quick enough, I’ll have to admit, certain scientists withheld information to have their thesis published first, the local government didn’t determine and release quick enough. But as soon as Dr. Zhong went there in person, announced that this disease can be transmitted from person to person which was right before the Chinese New Year, the government responded straight away at the the cost of huge economy loss. Locking down cities, cover all types of media and press with how to stay safe, why its highly encouraged to stay home and all kinds of essential information, and many nearby villages and towns are also in lock down or curfews. We didn’t have to do this. We could’ve done what the US did back in 2009, recover while losing. But we did the right thing before anybody looked our way, even the WHO only looked I’m our way AFTER we announced all the measures were taking. But now our people are suffering for it because of politics essentially. 
It is very sad that we have to feel like maybe we didn’t have to do this, even though we all know by our heart that this is the right thing to do.
Please follow reliable and neutral sources like the WHO. Because let’s put the global economy aside, because I can say damaging China further eventually brings down the global economy all together, but some may not believe me, and some will say that China will be the one to lose the lost and that’s enough for them. So let’s put that aside. Let’s look at what kind of message is this delivering to the latest of the world?
With how the world works right now, an epidemic like this may easily happen again. If this is how China is being treated, do we think that specific nation will still choose to do the right thing? Do we WANT them to do the right thing? If it was your country right now, and you see how the world responds to honesty and responsible actions, will you choose to do the same thing still?
Please do think about what kind of a world we want to live in? Or at least feel safer to live in. That’s all I’ve got to say.

snippet.textDisplay: Ok Don't over hype China's ability in providing sufficient heathcare as I'm kinda doubtful. Sometimes having something build is more often then not keeping their peoples attention & mind occupied rather then letting them think that their government can't do much to help. We only can pray for them as they don't really have enough heathcare workers and doctors to handle the volume of infected patients and even test kit could be in shortage. There is currently no vaccine, so working round the clock with international scientist to fastrack their research and hopefully can get one out within a few months. The virus is really taking a toll on their people, while during this testing time, it is best for their goverment to be able to give Chinese people some hope and try their best to hold together and stay strong. When there is not cure, have to work on HOPE. Wish them luck.

Vaccines.. yea, the usual stuff. Not mentioing the peple who died last time of the flu vaccines.. always the same : vaccines vaccines.. if any use would be of it, would be a reason, but vaccines are confirmed to be dangerous, and being bad for health.

Why not a single line is said about that, how important the immune system is? How important to keep healthy? Why not a single lesson about real vitamin needs and on? Why not a single government action on keeping health of people, by slowing down community, less work hours, more salaries, free supplements or so?

Always the same... go vaccinate.. but no real actions. Vccines are prooven to be harmful to ppls health.

Time to grow up for some ppl. People with power in their hands, or in position to transiting peoples opinion are also have big responsibility in their actions.
You as a doctor, would also teach about the connection of immune system and corona virus, also more about the virus itself, about thee viruses in general, and the class of corona virus (since there are lots different types of c viruses long ago among ppl).

snippet.textDisplay:
I live in China. If you go out on the street you’ll see that it’s almost empty outside at day or at night even in the remote area of the country, not just in Hubei. Nobody dares to walk on the street without wearing a mask. Malls, restaurants, cinemas...all this places are shut down. Students start watching online courses at home instead of going to school. I have been stayed in home for almost three weeks, it kills me when I really want to gout out to meet my friends. But I know that staying in home is the best I can do to help.
So yeah, the situation are worst than we thought. But it’s getting better. The whole world is helping us.

snippet.textDisplay: Hey Mike, I was working in UW hospital and I recently volunteered to went to HuBei to deal with the virus. Its worse than you think it is. Right now there are not enough medical staffs, and basically the whole province is infected. This virus is special, even if u are infected, it may takes 2 weeks or more, or even some people they will never show active symptoms. Thats y its so difficult to deal with. From what I know, the official infect and fatality rate are made up. The Chinese government is hiding the real number of dead and infected case. I will probably get caught by Chinese officials for posting here, but its important that you guys should know whats really going on here. People die, including doctors. People are right to be anxious, because they are infected, and we are lack of help and resources. And btw to people who think its wrong to go to doctor because thats how the virus spread, right now the situation in China is that even the citizen shows symptoms and call the officials, they just get ignored.  Because we are lack of manpower, and almost everyone call the number says they have symptoms. The hospital I am working in is packed, some of my colleague stays there for 100 hours without leaving. Right now what we are ordered to do is to control the virus instead of treating the patient. So far what we know is how to kill the virus, which is temperature and alcohol, but we are still working on treating the infected patient

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks for the info. I know the major target of this video are the Americans. You tried to explain that for those who live in a well developed country, they shouldn't worry too much... unlike the situation in china.... However, I'd like to clarify that unlike the other parts of china, Hong Kong is very well developed, but we are in great danger right now because of our government. Ever since the lock down of the city of Wuhan, our medics and specialists in the field had been urging the government to restrict the mainlanders from crossing the borders, as an overly crowded small city like ours won't have the capacity for the number rushing in. Hong Kong people's safety and well being are being largely compromised by the Hong Kong government for not closing the borders and keep mainlanders coming to Hong Kong. The reason, they say, was that if we shut them out, it would be an act of discrimination... We now have confirmed cases that have not been to mainland china, and we can't even track the source... that's a sign of community infection. Yet, hundreds of thousands of possibly infected mainlanders are rushing through the borders everyday. The scary thing about these mainlanders is that, they lie about their travel history. Please be cautious and do not trust the Chinese government on the fatality rates. They are hiding the numbers... people who died before their tests results come back won't be recorded as the death caused by the virus; large number of patients won't even get admitted to the hospitals in mainland china, and thus those deaths won't be added to the number either. Please don't underestimate this epidemic.
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks for the info. I know the major target of this video are the Americans. You tried to explain that for those who live in a well developed country, they shouldn't worry too much... unlike the situation in china.... However, I'd like to clarify that unlike the other parts of china, Hong Kong is very well developed, but we are in great danger right now because of our government. Ever since the lock down of the city of Wuhan, our medics and specialists in the field had been urging the government to restrict the mainlanders from crossing the borders, as an overly crowded small city like ours won't have the capacity for the number rushing in. Hong Kong people's safety and well being are being largely compromised by the Hong Kong government for not closing the borders and keep mainlanders coming to Hong Kong. The reason, they say, was that if we shut them out, it would be an act of discrimination... We now have confirmed cases that have not been to mainland china, and we can't even track the source... that's a sign of community infection. Yet, hundreds of thousands of possibly infected mainlanders are rushing through the borders everyday. The scary thing about these mainlanders is that, they lie about their travel history. Please be cautious and do not trust the Chinese government on the fatality rates. They are hiding the numbers... people who died before their tests results come back won't be recorded as the death caused by the virus; large number of patients won't even get admitted to the hospitals in mainland china, and thus those deaths won't be added to the number either. Please don't underestimate this epidemic.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hey Dr. Mike, thank you so much for your very informative videos that do wonders to ease my anxiety. The date I'm making this comment is Feb 7, 2020. Evidence that community spread of the coronavirus in Singapore has occurred. Our Ministry of Health has stepped up their risk assessment to an orange alert which indicates that the disease is severe and spread easily from person to person. However, the disease has not yet spread widely and is being contained. Other than stocking up on masks and hand sanitizers, people find themselves charged with a brand new mission, scrambling to stock up on a chock full of basic supplies like toilet paper, instant noodles, and rice til the shelves a wiped cleaned. It's turning into an apocalypse situation.

Do you think this shopping rush is an overreaction? Is there anything I should be saying to family and friends in order to calm them down? Because I am having trouble even convincing myself.
snippet.textOriginal:
Hey Dr. Mike, thank you so much for your very informative videos that do wonders to ease my anxiety. The date I'm making this comment is Feb 7, 2020. Evidence that community spread of the coronavirus in Singapore has occurred. Our Ministry of Health has stepped up their risk assessment to an orange alert which indicates that the disease is severe and spread easily from person to person. However, the disease has not yet spread widely and is being contained. Other than stocking up on masks and hand sanitizers, people find themselves charged with a brand new mission, scrambling to stock up on a chock full of basic supplies like toilet paper, instant noodles, and rice til the shelves a wiped cleaned. It's turning into an apocalypse situation.

Do you think this shopping rush is an overreaction? Is there anything I should be saying to family and friends in order to calm them down? Because I am having trouble even convincing myself.

snippet.textDisplay: The only TRUTH you all need to understand is is that China is under-reporting the number of infected and those killed by the coronavirus. The “official” record of infected coming from China is 24,000 and around 600 dead. In actuality, more than 90,000 have been infected and 30,000 have died. Just think about it people. If everything was really under control and not as bad as people are saying, why else would China have built 2 brand new hospitals in 10 days and put more than 50 million on lock down? Chinese culture is all about not losing face and maintaining social harmony. China lies about everything, so why not lie about this?  Listen people, do your own research and don’t just trust WHO because they’re heavily influenced by the Chinese government.
snippet.textOriginal: The only TRUTH you all need to understand is is that China is under-reporting the number of infected and those killed by the coronavirus. The “official” record of infected coming from China is 24,000 and around 600 dead. In actuality, more than 90,000 have been infected and 30,000 have died. Just think about it people. If everything was really under control and not as bad as people are saying, why else would China have built 2 brand new hospitals in 10 days and put more than 50 million on lock down? Chinese culture is all about not losing face and maintaining social harmony. China lies about everything, so why not lie about this?  Listen people, do your own research and don’t just trust WHO because they’re heavily influenced by the Chinese government.
